overall_summary: The reasoning process focuses on forecasting hourly data with daily seasonality, emphasizing cautious handling of potential missing values and selecting appropriate models given limited historical data (96 points). The analysis explores multiple methods but converges on a simple averaging approach due to data constraints, leveraging daily pattern repetition while acknowledging uncertainty in trend estimation.
common_data_patterns: Negative daytime values with positive nighttime values
key_insights: Data limitations (4 days) favor simple methods over complex models
Daily seasonality extraction through hourly averaging
Importance of separating daily mean and seasonal components
High uncertainty in long-horizon forecasting with short history
Trade-off between model complexity and data availability
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with statistical considerations (seasonality decomposition, stationarity checks) and heuristic adjustments for practical implementation. Combines theoretical model exploration with data-driven simplifications.
